intro: Icarus filiformis, commonly known as the slender icarus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its slender, branching stems and pale yellow flowers make it a distinctive species in its habitat. Icarus filiformis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salty air and coastal winds.
